settings.text: Integrity, from the Latin word ‘integritas,’ means honesty and straightforwardness - values that are woven into every aspect of everything we do at Wax London. Our commitment goes beyond making great clothes; it's about caring for the people who craft them and the planet that inspires and nurtures us collectively.

Being part of a global community that cares.

Fair working conditions for everyone in our supply chain.

Quality over quantity: ‘Less is more’.

Reducing waste and extending the life of our products.

Minimising our environmental impact.

Eliminating harmful chemicals and processes.

We align our actions with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), focusing on People, Product, and Environment. These principles guide every decision we make.

People (SDG3, SDG 5, SDG 8 AND SDG10)
We are committed to creating a positive impact by championing gender equality and promoting inclusion throughout our supply chain. We support fair labour rights, safe workplaces, and celebrate diversity by standing against all forms of discrimination.

Product (SDG12)
Our commitment to responsible consumption and circular design means we craft products that last, reducing the need for new resources. We prioritise sustainable materials with our designs supporting a circular economy, encouraging repair, reuse, recycling and zero waste.

Environment (SDG13, SDG6, SDG14)
We actively work towards reducing our carbon footprint, environmental preservation, improving water quality, reducing pollution, and waste management by working with suppliers who are proactive in technological adoption and who also share our core values.

At the heart of Wax London is a dedication to those who make it all possible and by honouring the people behind our products.

Well-being first ensures every individual, from our team members to those in our supply chain, benefits from rigorous health and safety standards.

Respect as a standard by treating each person with dignity and celebrating the diversity and uniqueness they bring to our brand.

Growth with Integrity by nurturing a culture of mutual support, we create space for both personal and professional growth, building a foundation for sustainable success.

Ethical commitment to best practice and fair labour where every piece we craft meets the highest standards, reflecting the care and respect we have for our partners and internal teams.

Community and purpose by supporting social initiatives in local communities and in regions where labour rights need a voice, aiming to leave a positive mark wherever we operate.

We are committed to crafting garments that are made to last, keeping them out of landfills and helping to reduce waste. We choose sustainable materials with low environmental impact where every choice made ensures that all our designs complement our sustainability values.

Responsible Material Sourcing
We consciously source low impact materials such as renewable fibres like cotton, viscose, wool, tagua palm buttons and recycled polyester and cotton as our commitment to reduce our impact on the planet.

Commitment to a Circular Economy
Our designs are focused on longevity and recyclability. Encouraging our customers to repair, reuse, and recycle to help extend the life of their garments. Every piece we create is designed to contribute to a sustainable lifecycle by supporting the circular economy.

No Waste Policy
Unsold items, fabric swatches, sampling accessories and customer returns never go to waste; instead, they find new homes through donations to local charities and universities, reinforcing our commitment to circularity and community.

We collaborate with trusted suppliers worldwide and invest in projects that uplift communities near our manufacturing partners in Pakistan and Bangladesh. These efforts include restoring mangrove forests in Pakistan’s Indus Delta, providing for local communities by sponsoring water desalination projects in Rota Dero, Pakistan and supporting education, healthcare, and income-generating skills for families in Dhaka’s slums. Closer to home, we donate clothes to homeless charities in Camden, helping restore dignity to those in need.

We trace the origins of all our materials and partner exclusively with suppliers who share our values. By mapping our entire supply chain, we can make informed and considered decisions that align with our commitment to creating a positive environmental and social impact.

Through close supplier collaborations, we trace every raw material, address potential risks, and embrace new opportunities to create positive change.

We know we’re not perfect, and navigating the complexities of sustainability can be challenging. However, we remain fully committed to transparency - sharing where we manufacture, our efforts to use low-impact resources, our dedication to ethical sourcing, and social impact initiatives.

Built to stand the test of time, each piece is designed to be more than just clothing - it’s a companion for life. Crafted with care and intention, these garments carry a story of legacy, made to journey alongside you through life’s moments. As the years pass, they’ll soften, crease, and fade in ways that are uniquely yours, weaving memories into the very fabric. Each mark tells a tale, each fade adds character, creating a garment that grows and evolves with you. This is more than fashion; it’s a legacy in the making, a tribute to quality, longevity, and the story that only you can bring to life.
